item.title: 2026 年是美元的悲惨一年，隧道尽头的曙光渺茫
item.description: 美元惨淡的一年即将结束，出现了企稳迹象，但许多投资者认为，随着全球经济增长回升和美联储进一步放宽政策，美元明年将重现跌势。【原文：A dismal year for the U.S. dollar is ending with signs of stabilization, but many investors believe the currency's decline will resume next year as global growth picks up and the Fed eases further.】

item.title: 优步和 Lyft 明年起在英国测试百度机器人出租车
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies）和Lyft将与中国科技巨头百度合作，明年在英国试运行无人驾驶出租车，这标志着全球机器人出租车商业化竞赛迈出了重要一步。【原文：Uber Technologies and Lyft are teaming up with Chinese tech giant Baidu to try out driverless taxis in the UK next year, marking a major step in the global race to commercialize robotaxis.】

item.title: 宏达电押注开放式人工智能战略以推动智能眼镜销售
item.description: 台湾宏达电（HTC）公司的高管表示，该公司新推出的人工智能眼镜可以让佩戴者选择他们想要使用的人工智能模型，因此该公司打赌其开放平台战略将使其能够在快速增长的智能眼镜行业建立市场份额。【原文：Taiwan’s HTC is betting its open platform strategy will allow it to build market share in the fast-growing smartglasses industry, as its newly launched AI-powered eyewear lets wearers choose which AI model they want to use, its executive said.】

item.title: 前央行政策制定者：上田领导下的日本央行将把利率上调至 1.5%
item.description: 日本央行前董事会成员樱井诚（Makoto Sakurai）周一告诉路透社，日本央行可能会在行长上田一夫至2028年初的剩余任期内再加息三次至1.5%。【原文：The Bank of Japan will likely raise interest rates three more times to 1.5% during Governor Kazuo Ueda's remaining term through early 2028, former central bank board member Makoto Sakurai told Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 意大利反垄断机构因苹果公司涉嫌滥用 App Store 市场支配地位对其处以罚款
item.description: 意大利竞争管理机构周一表示，已对美国科技巨头苹果公司及其两家子公司处以 9860 万欧元（1.1553 亿美元）的罚款，原因是它们涉嫌滥用在 iOS 用户移动应用程序分销方面的支配地位。【原文：Italy's competition authority said on Monday it had fined U.S tech giant Apple and two of its units 98.6 million euros ($115.53 million) over alleged abuse of dominant position for the distribution of mobile applications for iOS users.】

item.title: Coty任命Markus Strobel自1月起担任临时首席执行官
item.description: 美国化妆品制造商科蒂公司（Coty）周一表示，已任命马库斯-施特罗贝尔（Markus Strobel）为临时首席执行官，自 1 月 1 日起生效。【原文：U.S. cosmetics maker Coty appointed Markus Strobel as its interim chief executive officer effective January 1, it said on Monday.】

item.title: 中国商务部副部长周五会见苹果公司首席运营官
item.description: 中国商务部周一发表声明称，中国商务部副部长李成钢和苹果公司首席运营官萨比汗在周五的一次会议上讨论了美国公司在中国的业务运营问题。【原文：China's Vice Commerce Minister Li Chenggang and Apple's Chief Operating Officer Sabih Khan discussed the U.S. firm's business operations in China in a meeting on Friday, a commerce ministry statement said on Monday.】

item.title: 研究显示，德国汽车出口受特朗普关税影响严重
item.description: 路透社周一看到的一份研究报告显示，2025 年前三季度，德国对美国的汽车出口下滑了近 14%，成为美国总统唐纳德-特朗普贸易战中受冲击最严重的德国工业部门。【原文：German car exports to the United States slumped by almost 14% in the first three quarters of 2025, making it the hardest-hit branch of German industry in U.S. President Donald Trump's trade war, according to a study seen by Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 在炮火中送达：新星邮政如何成为乌克兰战时的成功典范
item.description: 俄罗斯入侵近四年来，新星邮政学会了如何在停电、导弹袭击和交通中断的情况下开展业务。现在，它每天投递的包裹超过 150 万个，巩固了其作为战时罕见的成功企业的地位。【原文：Nearly four years into Russia's invasion, Nova Post has learned to operate through blackouts, missile strikes and broken transport links. It now delivers more than 1.5 million parcels a day, cementing its status as a rare wartime corporate success.】

item.title: 特朗普震撼了今年的全球贸易；2026 年可能仍存在一些不确定性
item.description: 2025 年，唐纳德-特朗普总统重返白宫，拉开了全球贸易狂热之年的序幕，对美国贸易伙伴征收关税的浪潮将进口税提高到了大萧条以来的最高水平，震荡了金融市场，并引发了一轮又一轮的贸易和投资协议谈判。【原文：President Donald Trump's return to the White House in 2025 kicked off a frenetic year for global trade, with waves of tariffs on U.S. trading partners that lifted import taxes to their highest since the Great Depression, roiled financial markets and sparked rounds of negotiations over trade and investment deals.】

item.title: 日本关注 7 万亿美元家庭储蓄带来的新债券需求
item.description: 日本希望利用该国 7 万亿美元的家庭储蓄来支持债券需求，计划推出新产品和激励措施，在近期零售销售火爆的基础上再接再厉，填补央行购买减少留下的空白。【原文：Japan is looking to the country's $7 trillion household savings hoard to support bond demand with plans to launch new products and incentives, building on hot recent retail sales and filling a void left by diminished central bank buying.】

item.title: 中国万科面临违约风险，命运取决于债券持有人的决定
item.description: 房地产开发商中国万科计划推迟一年偿还 20 亿元人民币（约合 2.84 亿美元）债券，并延长宽限期，以避免立即违约，投资者正在等待投票结果。【原文：Investors are awaiting the results of a vote on property developer China Vanke's plan to delay repayment of a 2 billion yuan ($284 million) bond by a year and extend its grace period, as it seeks to avoid an immediate default.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚广播公司推迟 "60 分钟 "关于萨尔瓦多 CECOT 监狱的报道
item.description: 哥伦比亚广播公司新闻频道在原定于周日播出的有关萨尔瓦多 CECOT 监狱的 "60 分钟 "报道播出前几小时撤下了该报道，称将在以后的时间播出。【原文：CBS News pulled a "60 Minutes" report on El Salvador's CECOT prison just hours before its scheduled Sunday broadcast, saying it would air at a future time.】

item.title: 美国周末拦截委内瑞拉油轮，油价上涨
item.description: 在美国周末拦截了一艘委内瑞拉油轮之后，油价在周一早盘攀升。【原文：Oil prices climbed in early trade on Monday after the U.S. intercepted a Venezuelan oil tanker over the weekend.】

item.title: 中国连续第七个月维持基准贷款利率不变
item.description: 周一，中国连续第七个月保持 12 月份基准贷款优惠利率（LPR）不变，符合市场预期。【原文：China left benchmark loan prime rates (LPRs) unchanged for the seventh consecutive month in December on Monday, matching market expectations.】

item.title: 亚洲股市延续科技股涨势，日元承压
item.description: 周一，亚洲股市追随华尔街科技股的涨势而上涨，而日元兑欧元和瑞士法郎则跌至历史低点，因为国内利率的上升丝毫没有阻止投机性卖盘。【原文：Asian share markets rose on Monday tracking tech-driven gains on Wall Street, while the yen wallowed at all-time lows against the euro and Swiss franc as higher interest rates at home did nothing to deter speculative sellers.】

item.title: 日本央行在加息后保持谨慎基调，日元兑欧元汇率跌至纪录低点附近
item.description: 日本央行行长上田一夫在上周五加息后坚持其一贯的谨慎言论，周一日元兑欧元在纪录低点附近徘徊。【原文：The yen languished near a record low to the euro on Monday, after Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda stuck to his usual cautious rhetoric following an interest rate hike on Friday.】

item.title: 美国周末拦截委内瑞拉油轮后油价上涨
item.description: 在美国周末拦截了一艘委内瑞拉油轮之后，油价在周一亚洲早盘交易时段上涨。【原文：Oil prices gained on Monday in early Asian trading hours after the U.S. intercepted a Venezuelan oil tanker over the weekend.】

item.title: 中国电力改革和全球数据中心建设迎来电池热潮
item.description: 就在国际电力需求激增之际，中国电力市场的改革提升了电力存储的经济性，从而引发了已在全球占据主导地位的中国储能制造商的蓬勃发展。【原文：A revamp of China's electricity market is boosting the economics of storing power just as international demand surges, sparking a boom for the Chinese energy storage manufacturers that already dominate globally.】

item.title: Seatrium 与马士基就价值 4.75 亿美元的海上风力发电船合同纠纷达成和解
item.description: 新加坡造船厂 Seatrium 周一表示，它已与丹麦马士基公司达成和解，将交付一艘海上风力发电船，该船将用于纽约沿海的一个项目。【原文：Singapore-based shipbuilder Seatrium said on Monday it has reached a settlement with Denmark's Maersk to deliver an offshore wind vessel that was intended to work on a project off the coast of New York.】

item.title: 福岛事故 15 年后，日本准备重启世界最大核电站
item.description: 日本新泻地区预计将于周一批准重启世界上最大核电站的决定，这是自 2011 年福岛核泄漏灾难以来日本重新转向核电的分水岭。【原文：The Japanese region of Niigata is expected to endorse a decision to restart the world's largest nuclear power plant on Monday, a watershed moment in the country's pivot back to nuclear since the 2011 Fukushima disaster.】

item.title: 新西兰法院驳回机场集团关于定价规则的上诉
item.description: 奥克兰机场周一表示，新西兰高等法院驳回了机场就商业委员会关于制定定价规则的报告提出的案情审查上诉。【原文：Auckland Airport said on Monday that the New Zealand High Court has declined a merits-review appeal filed by airports that had challenged a Commerce Commission report on setting pricing rules.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Permira 和 Warburg 接近以 82 亿美元收购 Clearwater Analytics
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，由 Permira 和华平投资集团牵头的私募股权投资公司已达成一项交易，将以约 82 亿美元（包括债务）收购投资和会计软件制造商 Clearwater Analytics Holdings。【原文：A group of private equity firms led by Permira and Warburg Pincus has clinched a deal to acquire investment and accounting software maker Clearwater Analytics Holdings for about $8.2 billion, including debt, two sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 瑞士内政部长对禁止儿童使用社交媒体持开放态度
item.description: 周日，瑞士内政部长伊丽莎白-鲍梅-施耐德（Elisabeth Baume-Schneider）被引述说，瑞士必须采取更多措施保护儿童免受社交媒体风险，这表明她对可能禁止青少年使用社交媒体平台持开放态度。【原文：Switzerland must do more to shield children from social media risks, Interior Minister Elisabeth Baume-Schneider was quoted as saying on Sunday, signalling she was open to a potential ban on the platforms for youngsters.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，美联储主席哈马克发出数月内保持利率稳定的信号
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周日报道，克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）表示，在央行过去三次降息会议之后，她认为数月内没有必要改变利率。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack said she sees no need to change interest rates for months after the central bank cut rates at its last three meetings, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 食品储藏室排起长队通货膨胀考验特朗普在密歇根州的基础
item.description: 最近的一个大雪纷飞的早晨，在密歇根州一个喜欢特朗普的农村地区，三十几辆车停在一个消防队改建的食品储藏室外。在里面，志愿者们正在打包莴苣、苹果和其他家庭主食，这些食物今年的价格有的飙升，有的居高不下。【原文：On a recent snowy morning in a Trump-loving part of rural Michigan, three dozen cars idled outside a firehouse-turned-food pantry. Inside, volunteers packaged lettuce, apples and other household staples that have surged or stayed high in price this year.】

item.title: 韩国消费者机构将责令 SK 电讯赔偿 58 名黑客受害者
item.description: 韩国消费者机构周日表示，将责令 SK Telecom 向 58 名用户作出赔偿，这些用户因最近发生的黑客攻击事件而对该公司提起集体诉讼。【原文：South Korea's consumer agency said on Sunday it would order SK Telecom to compensate 58 users who filed a class action against the company over a recent hacking incident.】

item.title: 罗氏公司首席执行官指出，美国交易后瑞士未来药品价格将上涨
item.description: 周六援引瑞士制药巨头罗氏公司首席执行官的话说，制药公司与华盛顿达成的降低美国药品价格的协议很可能会推高瑞士新药的成本。【原文：Deals between pharmaceutical companies and Washington to reduce prices for medicines in the United States will likely push up the cost of new drugs in Switzerland, the CEO of Swiss pharma giant Roche was quoted as saying on Saturday.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克在法院就薪酬方案作出裁决后成为身价 7000 亿美元的第一人
item.description: 据福布斯亿万富豪指数显示，在特拉华州最高法院恢复去年作废的价值 1,390 亿美元的特斯拉股票期权后，特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克的净资产飙升至 7,490 亿美元。【原文：Tesla CEO Elon Musk's net worth surged to $749 billion after the Delaware Supreme Court reinstated Tesla stock options worth $139 billion that were voided last year, according to Forbes' billionaires index.】

item.title: 解说员TikTok 的算法有什么特别之处？
item.description: 在线短视频平台 TikTok 的内容推荐算法再次成为人们关注的焦点，因为该应用的中国所有者字节跳动公司（ByteDance）签署了一项具有约束力的协议，将组建一家合资企业，把 TikTok 美国应用的运营控制权交给美国和全球投资者，其中包括云计算公司甲骨文公司（Oracle）。【原文：The content recommendation algorithm that powers the online short video platform TikTok has once again come under the spotlight after the app's Chinese owner ByteDance signed binding agreements to form a joint venture that will hand control of operations of TikTok's U.S. app to American and global investors, including cloud computing company Oracle .】
